required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Initial Performance of the MediSieve Magnetic Haemofiltration System
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Investigation of the Safety and Initial Performance of the MediSieve Magnetic Haemofiltration System in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a single centre, prospective, non-randomised healthy volunteer study to be undertaken at University College Hospital London.
The study will be used to demonstrate the safe use of the MediSieve blood filtration system in healthy volunteers prior to undertaking clinical trials on patients with relevant pathologies.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability, measured by incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the study duration of 2 months and within the 6 month time period following treatment with the study device. following treatment
primary_outcome.description: Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events during the study and the 6 month period after volunteers exit the study. Definitions from ISO14155 will be used to categorise Adverse Events

secondary_outcome.measure: Performance of device during use. Time required for the user to set up and shut down the haemofiltration pump..
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months...
secondary_outcome.description: Set up and shut down duration. The time, in minutes, to set up and shut down the haemofiltration pump will be recorded for each participant..

secondary_outcome.measure: Performance of device during use will be assessed by the incidence of flow-rate alarms on the haemofiltration pump during use.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Device performance will be assessed by the incidence of alarms on the haemofiltration pump that are triggered by blood flow through the pump falling below pre-set level..

arm_group.description: All volunteers will receive the same treatment

intervention.description: The MediSieve Magnetic Haemofiltration System is a medical device intended for use in extracorporeal clinical procedures to remove magnetic targets (e.g. malaria infected red blood cells) from a patient's bloodstream.
